file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 52-43-01-04 - SERVICE-DOOR ELEVATION CAM - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL SERVICE-DOOR ELEVATION CAM - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the elevation cam of the service door mechanism. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY SERVICE DOOR ELEVATION CAM - RE- ALL 52-43-01-000-801-A MOVAL SERVICE DOOR ELEVATION CAM - IN- ALL 52-43-01-400-801-A STALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 52-43-01 Page 1 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 52-43-01-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. SERVICE DOOR ELEVATION CAM - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove the elevation cam of the service door mechanism. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 25-23-05-000-801-A/400 SERVICE DOOR LINING PANELS - REMOVAL AMM TASK 52-43-00-000-801-A/400 SERVICE DOOR - REMOVAL C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 821 Service door D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Maintenance shop I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Remove the lining panels of the service door (AMM TASK 25-23-05-000-801-A/400). (2) Remove the service door (AMM TASK 52-43-00-000-801-A/400). (3) Put the door on a safe place to prevent scratches to the door. J. Removal (Figure 401) (Figure 402) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Remove the spring (12). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 52-43-01 Page 2 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (2) Remove the cotter pin, flat washer, and straight pin (9), and the bearing (8) to disconnect the lever (7) from the cam (11). (3) Remove the nut, washer, and bolt (10) and remove the cam (11) from the end of the torque tube (16). (4) Remove the cotter pin, nut, washer, and bolt (5) to disconnect the end of the rod (4) from the bellcrank (13). (5) Remove the nut, washer, and bolt (6), and remove the bellcrank (13) from the torque tube (16). (6) Remove the spacer (14) from the torque tube (16). (7) To get access to the cam (15), it is necessary to remove the door arm. To remove the door arm, do as follows (Figure 402): (a) Remove the cotter pin (12), nut (11), washer (10), bolt (14), and the washers (13) and (15) (Det. C on Figure 402). (b) Remove the cotter pin (5), nut (6), washer (7), bolt (9), washer (8), and the bushings (3) and (4) (Det. B on Figure 402). CAUTION: BE CAREFUL NOT TO CUT OR CAUSE OTHER DAMAGE TO THE WIRE (2). (c) Pull up the door arm (1) to get access to the bellcrank. (8) Remove the cotter pin, nut, washer, and special bolt (1), and the bushing (23) to disconnect the bellcrank (2) from the cam (15). (9) Remove the nut, washer, and bolt (21) to disconnect the tube (18) from the torque tube (16). (10) Remove the retaining ring (22) from the torque tube (16). (11) Push the torque tube (16) to the right side of the door. (12) Remove the nut, washer, and bolt (20) to disconnect the tube (19) from the tube (18). (13) Remove the tube (18). (14) Remove the nut, washer, and bolt (3). (15) Push the torque tube (16) to the left side of the door. (16) Remove the cam (15). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 52-43-01 Page 3 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Elevation Cam - Removal/Installation Figure 401 B A ZONE 821 DET. A 1. SPECIAL BOLT WASHER NUT COTTERPIN 2. BELLCRANK 20. BOLT WASHER NUT EXTERNAL 21. BOLT HANDLE WASHER ( REF. ) NUT 3. BOLT WASHER 4. ROD NUT 22. RETAINING RING 5. BOLT WASHER NUT COTTERPIN 23. BUSHING 6. BOLT WASHER NUT 7. LEVER 19. TUBE 18. TUBE 8. BEARING 16. TORQUE 17. SPACER TUBE 9. STRAIGHT PIN FLAT WASHER COTTERPIN STRUCTURE 15. CAM (REF.) 10. BOLT WASHER NUT 14. SPACER STRUCTURE (REF.) 11. CAM 13. BELLCRANK 12. SPRING SUPPORT (DOOR STRUCTURE) DET. B (REF.) 145AMM520119.MCE B EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 52-43-01 Page 4 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Service Door Arm - Removal/Installation Figure 402 A 1. DOOR ARM ZONE 821 B 1 2. WIRE 1. DOOR ARM C 13. WASHER DET. A 14. BOLT 15. WASHER 12. COTTERPIN 3. BUSHING 11. NUT 4. BUSHING 10. WASHER DET. C 9. BOLT 8. WASHER 1. DOOR ARM 6. NUT 5. COTTERPIN 1 7. WASHER DO NOT CUT THE WIRE. DET. B 145AMM520414.MCE EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 52-43-01 Page 5 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 52-43-01-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. SERVICE DOOR ELEVATION CAM - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install the elevation cam of the service door mechanism. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 25-23-05-400-801-A/400 SERVICE DOOR LINING PANELS - INSTALLATION AMM TASK 52-43-00-400-801-A/400 SERVICE DOOR - INSTALLATION SERVICE-DOOR ACTUATING AND LOCKING MECH- AMM TASK 52-43-06-700-801-A/500 ANISM - FUNCTIONAL CHECK IPC 52-43-11 SERVICE DOOR - MECHANISM C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 821 Service door D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expendable Parts IPC REFERENCE ITEM QTY (VENDOR REFERENCE) Cotter pin IPC 52-43-11 3 H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Maintenance shop I. Installation (Figure 401) (Figure 402) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Put the torque tube (16) in the door structure. (2) Put the cam (15) on the torque tube (16). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 52-43-01 Page 6 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (3) Push the torque tube (16) to the right side of the door. (4) Put the end of the tube (18) in the end of the tube (19). (5) Put the spacer (17) on the end of the torque tube (16) and install the retaining ring (22). (6) Connect the end of the torque tube (16) to the end of the tube (18). Install the bolt, washer, and nut (21) to attach them. (7) Install the bolt, washer, and nut (20) to attach the ends of the tubes (18) and (19). (8) Put the cam (15) in the bellcrank (2). (9) Install the bolt, washer, and nut (3) to attach the cam (15) to the torque tube (16). (10) Install the bushing (23), and the special bolt, washer, nut, and cotter pin (1) to attach the cam (15) to the bellcrank (2). (11) Put the spacer (14) on the torque tube (16). (12) Put the bellcrank (13) on the torque tube (16). (13) Connect the end of the rod (4) to the bellcrank (13). Install the bolt, washer, nut, and cotter pin (5) to attach it. (14) Install the bolt, washer, and nut (6) to attach the bellcrank (13) to the torque tube (16). (15) Put the cam (11) on the end of the torque tube (16) and in the lever (7). (16) Install the bearing (8) and the straight pin, flat washer, and cotter pin (9) to attach the cam (11) to the lever (7). (17) Install the bolt, washer, and nut (10) to attach the cam (11) to the end of the torque tube (16). (18) Install the spring (12) between the lever (7) and the support at the door structure. (19) Install the door arm (1) as follows (Figure 402): (a) Put the door arm (1) on the door. (b) Put the bushings (3) and (4) (Det. B in (Figure 402). (c) Install the washer (8) on the bolt (9) (Det. B in (Figure 402). (d) Install the bolt (9) (Det. B in (Figure 402). (e) Install the washer (7), nut (6), and cotter pin (5) (Det. B in (Figure 402). (f) Install the washer (15) on the bolt (14) (Det. C in (Figure 402). (g) Put the washer (13) between the door arm (1) and the support. (h) Install the bolt (14) (Det. C in (Figure 402). (i) Install the washer (10), nut (11), and cotter pin (12) (Det. C in (Figure 402). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 52-43-01 Page 7 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Install the service door (AMM TASK 52-43-00-400-801-A/400). (2) Do a functional check of the service door ( AMM TASK 52-43-06-700-801-A/500). (3) Install the lining panels of the service door (AMM TASK 25-23-05-400-801-A/400). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 52-43-01 Page 8 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
